reporting-org.narrative: Environmental Centre for Oil Spills and Gas Flaring (NACGOND)

title.narrative: Activity 1: Training of NACGOND & Community Members on Networking and Coalition Building; Advocacy Campaigns, Lobbying, Social Media (New Media), Documentation techniques; legal frameworks of the PIB, NOSDRA Amendment Bill, EIA Act, National Climate Change Policy and the Gas Master Plan to enhance Review or develop policy briefs for Advocacy.

description.narrative: Facilitate civil society and communities to carry out evidence-based advocacy and media campaigns for the enforcement and implementation of adequate policies on environmental management and protection.

activity-date.narrative: These three activities were basically targeted at two different, but intertwined issues of capacity building of community persons/ NACGOND partners and improve their advocacy skills to mainstream engagements for good environmental governance by the Nigerian state. This way, it was expected that the coalition would better undertake the important function of leading opinions in advocating for better understanding and improved relationships between communities, oil sector operator and the Government of Nigeria.

baseline.value: More than 60% of NACGOND member organisations and 98% of community persons rely solely on NACGOND coalition to pressurize regulatory agencies to enforce environmental policy.

dimension.name: Percentage of independent advocacies carried out by NACGOND members and targeted communities without relying on NACGOND coalition in representing their interest.
dimension.value: Activity recorded 86% increase in rate of participation by NACGOND members and 56% of community persons using different channels including social media to advocate for enforcement of environmental standards out of 21 partner organizations of NACGOND and 124 community persons who participated in the training.

comment.narrative: Capacity of NACGOND member (organizations) and community persons is significantly enhanced leading to about 86% rate of participation by NACGOND member (organizations) and 56% rate for community persons independently undertaking environmental advocacy for policy enforcement using different channels including social media.

target.value: 26% achieved reduction in the rate at which NACGOND coalition member (organizations) still depend on the coalition as a body to pressurize regulatory agencies to enforce environmental policy compared to pre-inception figure of 60%. For the community persons who initially relied on the coalition as a body to pressurize regulatory agencies, there is recorded 42% reduction from the 98% initial rate.
